briefdescription.para: Bind option's paramter as number to referenced variable.

detaileddescription.para:
p_target
Reference variable
p_min
Minimum parameter value [inclusive]
p_max
Maximum parameter value [inclusive]
generated option callback Will led to an error if input parameter :
not lexically convertible to T
is lower than p_min
is greater than p_max

briefdescription.para: Bind option's parameter to target variable and checks among authorized values.

parameterdescription.para: Iterable container of authorized option's values

briefdescription.para: Append option's parameter to target container for each command line hit.
Prints error on standard error and exit.
Prints error and usage on standard error and exit.
Prints a warning on standard error.
Parses arguments from main(int,char**) function.

sect1.title: Introcution
sect1.para:
This object provides a default application skeleton including :
user-friendly wrapping of argument parsing (on top of C's getopt_long)
usage generator for declared options
default options : help and log-level
default logging facility
signal handling on a separate thread
binary RCS identity tracking, usually generated by xtd compile-time dependency tracking system

sect1.title: How to use

listitem.para: Declare your program arguments in your constructor
Optionaly parse your configuration, check your parameters and initialize your application in the dedicated methods
Instantiate your class in main(int,char**) function and all Application::execute method

para.plantuml: (*) --> initialize default logging (level::crit) --> read arguments from argc & argv --> parseConfig() note right: User may redefine this function --> checkOptions() --> initialize logging with parsed level note right: User may redefine this function --> initialize() note right: User may redefine this function --> ===B1=== --> start signal thread --> stop & join signal thread --> ===B2=== ===B1=== --> process() note left: User must re-define this function --> ===B2=== --> (*)

listitem.para: bindDir : Bind option's parameter to a directory.
bindFile : Bind option's parameter to a file name.
bindGiven : Set targeted variable to true if option is given on command line.
bindString : Set targeted variable to option's parameter.
bindCallback : Associate option to given generic callback.
bindValueIfGiven : Set given value to referenced variable if option is given.
bindNumber : Bind option's paramter as number to referenced variable.
bindValues : Bind option's parameter to target variable and checks among authorized values.
bindAccumulator : Append option's parameter to target container for each command line hit.
